definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup

sentences.english: The bacteria quickly multiplied in its beakers into trillions of cells.
sentences.chinese: 這細菌在燒杯中很快就繁殖到數以兆計。

sentences.english: Place the multiplier in the beaker and fill with Heptane until multiplier is fully immersed.
sentences.chinese: 將倍增器放入燒杯中並倒入正庚烷直至浸沒倍增器。

sentences.english: You make hot cocoa with a Bunsen burner and a beaker.
sentences.chinese: 做熱可可的時候，你得用到本生噴燈和燒杯。

sentences.english: First , I take a beaker of water and heat it gently over a bunsen burner .
sentences.chinese: 首先，取一燒杯的水，在本生燈上微微加熱。

sentences.english: There is some deposit in the bottom of the flask.
sentences.chinese: 這隻燒杯的底部有些沉澱物。

sentences.english: She grinned and took the beaker out of her pocket.
sentences.chinese: 她笑了一下，拿出了那個燒杯。

sentences.english: When he added some alcohol into the beaker the worms doubled-up and died.
sentences.chinese: 當他把一些酒精加進燒杯時，蠕蟲彎曲身體並死去。

sentences.english: The beaker was placed on top of a torch.
If are to in proof of that, put your ring in a beaker of it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想驗證下，可以把戒指放在裝有王水的燒杯中。

sentences.english: Actually, it seems that frogs will not remain in a beaker that is slowly heated.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，青蛙好像不會乖乖留在慢慢加熱的燒杯中。

sentences.english: The glass beakers fell as she climbed on a counter and slid across to the other side of the room.
sentences.chinese: 當她爬上一個櫃子的時候弄倒了一個玻璃燒杯。

sentences.english: We let the solution settle, then we recover the brown powder collected at the bottom of the beaker.
sentences.chinese: 等反應穩定之後我們從燒杯底部回收黃色的粉末。

sentences.english: The beakers were tagged with a number.
